titleStmt.title: Certaine praiers collected out of a fourme of godly meditations, set foorth by her Maiesties authoritie in the great mortalitie, in the fift yeere of her Highnesse raigne, and most necessarie to be vsed at this time in the like present visitation of Gods heauie hand for our manifold sinnes, and commended vnto the ministers and people of London, by the Reuerend Father in God, Iohn Bishop of London, &c. Iuly. 1593..
titleStmt.author: Church of England.

titleStmt.title: Certaine praiers collected out of a fourme of godly meditations, set foorth by her Maiesties authoritie in the great mortalitie, in the fift yeere of her Highnesse raigne, and most necessarie to be vsed at this time in the like present visitation of Gods heauie hand for our manifold sinnes, and commended vnto the ministers and people of London, by the Reuerend Father in God, Iohn Bishop of London, &c. Iuly. 1593..
titleStmt.author: Church of England.
Dyson, Humphrey, d. 1633, former owner.

publicationStmt.publisher: by the deputies of Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie.,

notesStmt.note: Title within ornamental border (McK. & F. 165); headpieces, initials.
Variant: title lacks the words "and commended .. &c.".
Former owner's autograph on t.p.: Hum: Dyson.
Reproductions of originals in:Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (2032:7) and British Library (reel 2340:3j).
